pages.title: ⤝ Knight of Swords ⤝
pages.text: Heir of Winds and Breezes$(br)        ∆ Fire of $(m)∆$() Air

A knight riding in full course, as if scattering their enemies. They hold their sword high, a display of dedication to their mission.$(br)  They remind us of a prototypical hero of romantic chivalry, whose sword is swift and sure because he is clean of heart.$(br)  The emblem of their suit is the classical weapon of the knight; one might say the entire suit of Swords moves around this card.$(br)  This Knight does not doubt

their purpose or their calling.$(br)  Whether attacking or defending, they do not hesitate to fulfill their duties with swift intellect and, if need be, force.$(br)  Wielding a sword is the privilege of knights. Therefore, this card can indicate a fearless warrior, or possibly a person with social advantages.$(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Wrath, opposition, resistance.$(br)  May represent a warrior,
a hero, someone of class or privilege.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Brashness, imprudence, extravagance.$(br)  Going too far, charging ahead when caution is a better policy.
